effect.text: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

tips: Calculate exact damage before using Defender
Use when the 20 reduction will prevent a knockout, not just reduce damage
Attach right before your opponent's turn, not in advance
Most valuable on Pokemon with critical roles
Multiple Defenders can be used over consecutive turns for extended protection

rulings.ruling: Defender attaches to a Pokemon and counts as a Tool card
Only one Defender can be attached to a Pokemon at a time (old Tool rule in Base Set era)
Damage reduction applies to all damage from attacks during opponent's turn
The 20 damage reduction applies after Weakness and Resistance calculations
Defender does not prevent damage; it reduces it by 20 (minimum 0 damage)
Defender automatically discards at the end of your opponent's next turn (not your turn)
If the Pokemon with Defender is benched or evolved, Defender remains attached until it discards
Defender does not prevent status conditions or other attack effects, only damage
Multiple sources of damage reduction (like Mr. Mime's Invisible Wall) can stack with Defender
If Defender reduces damage to 0, no damage is dealt
Defender works against all attacks, including multiple attacks in one turn (if that were possible)
